results.title: Yeni hayat = New life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kenan Besiroglu and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kenan Besiroglu migrated to Australia with his wife and son in 1970. This is a story of hard work, perseverance and the promise of a new life.

results.title: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.brief_description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.

results.title: Going to my mum's house
results.creator_credit: Debbie Lissek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Debbie lives in a hostel, but spends weekends at her mum’s house. In this story, Debbie gives an outline of the activities she and her mum routinely enjoy on the weekends.

results.title: [Remix: Hats]
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, ACMI Collections and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to hats and how we wear them. A remix of home movies and short works in the ACMI Collection featuring styles, shapes and fabrics of hats. Whether at the beach, riding a horse, driving a racing car or going for a swim, a fashionable head-covering is a must. Australian fashion’s best styles of hats for men, women and children from the 1930s to the 1980s are shown.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Tony Agapitos, Karen Wootton, The Gadsden Family, Elenor Peach, Karen Corry, Jenny & Owen Peake, Gil Brealey & Paul Olson and John Richardson.

results.title: Let's not say goodbye
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The destruction of Australia’s bushland and forests threatens already endangered species. Members of the Theatre in Education and the Real Fantasy Theatre Company take a humorous look at this serious problem.

results.title: Chorus and principals on stage please
results.brief_description: A co-production by Film Australia and the Australian Opera, this film of compelling interest to opera-lovers features throughout Australian stars Joan Sutherland and Richard Bonynge. We are taken behind the Sydney Opera House curtain to explore many of the preparations required to stage such an opera as “Lakma”. With shooting undertaken in Sydney and New York the film leaves a lively impression of the problems of running an opera

results.title: Ask an Australian about her household [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the way of life common to an Australian housewife in her household management, and the goods, services and types of housing available - (1970’s point-of-view). Note: young male child nude in shower scene, may not be suitable for public screening. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Alan Alda, Martin Bregman, Louis A. Stroller and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.

results.title: Candleshoe
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An adventure story about a noble lady and her orphans fighting to remain in their mansion after being threatened with eviction if the estate taxes are not paid. Lady St Edmund (Helen Hayes), aware of the legend about one of her ancestors supposedly having hidden a treasure of gold coins somewhere in the mansion, unwittingly finds herself a victim of a set-up by two unscrupulous characters, Bundage (Leo McKern) and Grimsworthy (Vivian Pickles), who also want to find the hidden money. Plotting and scheming the pair persuade a young urchin Casey (Jodie Foster), to help them by posing as Lady St Edmund’s long-lost granddaughter. Features David Niven as Priory, Lady St Edmund’s butler, gardener, chauffeur and right-hand man.
